titles.name: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
titles.short-desc: An orphaned boy enrolls in a school of wizardry, where he learns the truth about himself, his family and the terrible evil that haunts the magical world.
titles.story: This is the tale of Harry Potter (Daniel Radcliffe), an ordinary eleven-year-old boy serving as a sort of slave for his aunt and uncle who learns that he is actually a wizard and has been invited to attend the Hogwarts School for Witchcraft and Wizardry. Harry is snatched away from his mundane existence by Rubeus Hagrid (Robbie Coltrane), the groundskeeper for Hogwarts, and quickly thrown into a world completely foreign to both him and the viewer. Famous for an incident that happened at his birth, Harry makes friends easily at his new school. He soon finds, however, that the wizarding world is far more dangerous for him than he would have imagined, and he quickly learns that not all wizards are ones to be trusted.

titles.name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
titles.short-desc: Harry Potter returns to Hogwarts for his second year, where the Chamber of Secrets has been opened and the Heir of Slytherin is causing havoc.
titles.story: In his second year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, Harry Potter (Daniel Radcliffe) encounters a mysterious diary that holds the key to uncovering the dark secrets of Hogwarts. As students are petrified by an unseen force, Harry and his friends Ron (Rupert Grint) and Hermione (Emma Watson) must confront the malevolent entity known as the Chamber of Secrets and its connection to Hogwarts' dark past. With the help of their friends and allies, Harry and his friends embark on a dangerous journey to save the school and unravel the truth behind the Chamber of Secrets.

titles.name: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
titles.short-desc: Harry Potter returns to Hogwarts for his third year, where he faces the dangerous escaped prisoner Sirius Black and learns more about his own past.
titles.story: In his third year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, Harry Potter (Daniel Radcliffe) discovers that the dangerous prisoner Sirius Black (Gary Oldman) has escaped from Azkaban, the wizarding prison. As Harry, along with his friends Ron (Rupert Grint) and Hermione (Emma Watson), unravels the truth about Sirius Black and his connection to Harry's family, they must confront the Dementors, soul-sucking creatures guarding Hogwarts, and face their own deepest fears. With the help of new Defense Against the Dark Arts professor Remus Lupin (David Thewlis) and the enigmatic Professor Dumbledore (Michael Gambon), Harry embarks on a thrilling adventure that will test his courage and reveal shocking secrets from the past.

titles.name: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
titles.short-desc: Harry Potter finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares.
titles.story: In his fourth year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, Harry Potter (Daniel Radcliffe) finds himself unexpectedly selected as a participant in the dangerous Triwizard Tournament, a competition between three wizarding schools. As Harry faces challenging tasks and deadly creatures, he must navigate the intricacies of the tournament while uncovering a dark plot that threatens not only Hogwarts but the entire wizarding world. With the support of his friends Ron (Rupert Grint) and Hermione (Emma Watson), Harry delves into the mysteries of the Goblet of Fire and confronts the growing menace of Lord Voldemort (Ralph Fiennes). The choices he makes will have far-reaching consequences for his future and the fate of the wizarding realm.

titles.name: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
titles.short-desc: As Lord Voldemort returns, Harry Potter forms a secret group to fight against the dark forces infiltrating Hogwarts.
titles.story: In his fifth year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, Harry Potter (Daniel Radcliffe) finds himself marginalized and discredited by the Ministry of Magic, which refuses to believe that Lord Voldemort (Ralph Fiennes) has returned. As dark forces infiltrate Hogwarts and threaten the safety of the students, Harry forms a secret organization called Dumbledore's Army to teach his peers defensive magic. Together, they prepare for the inevitable battle against Voldemort and his Death Eaters. As Harry faces visions and trials, he learns the importance of loyalty, friendship, and standing up for what is right in the face of adversity.

titles.name: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
titles.short-desc: As Harry Potter prepares for a final battle against Lord Voldemort, he uncovers crucial information about Voldemort's past.
titles.story: In his sixth year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, Harry Potter (Daniel Radcliffe) receives a private tutorship from Professor Dumbledore (Michael Gambon) to learn more about Lord Voldemort's (Ralph Fiennes) past and his quest for immortality. As Harry delves into memories and secrets, he uncovers crucial information that could help him in his final battle against Voldemort. Meanwhile, romance blooms and dark forces threaten to disrupt the wizarding world. Harry and his friends must navigate love, loyalty, and sacrifice as they prepare for the ultimate confrontation with the Dark Lord.

titles.name: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 1
titles.short-desc: As Harry Potter embarks on a mission to destroy Voldemort's Horcruxes, he uncovers the existence of the Deathly Hallows.
titles.story: In the seventh installment, which is split into two parts, Harry Potter (Daniel Radcliffe), along with his friends Ron (Rupert Grint) and Hermione (Emma Watson), embarks on a dangerous quest to destroy the Horcruxes—objects containing pieces of Lord Voldemort's (Ralph Fiennes) soul. As they travel across the wizarding world, they face perilous challenges and dark forces. Along the way, they uncover the existence of the Deathly Hallows, three magical artifacts that could grant ultimate power to the one who possesses them. As the trio races against time, they must make difficult choices and confront their own fears in the face of a growing war.

titles.name: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2
titles.short-desc: In the epic finale, Harry Potter confronts Lord Voldemort in the ultimate battle between good and evil.
titles.story: In the final chapter of the Harry Potter series, Harry Potter (Daniel Radcliffe) and his friends Ron (Rupert Grint) and Hermione (Emma Watson) continue their mission to destroy the remaining Horcruxes, objects that contain pieces of Lord Voldemort's (Ralph Fiennes) soul. As they face mounting challenges and sacrifices, they uncover the truth about the Deathly Hallows and the final confrontation with Voldemort becomes inevitable. Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry becomes the battleground for the ultimate battle between good and evil. The fate of the wizarding world hangs in the balance as Harry prepares for the ultimate sacrifice to save his friends and fulfill his destiny.

titles.name: Game of Thrones
titles.short-desc: A fantasy drama series set in the fictional continents of Westeros and Essos, where noble families vie for control of the Iron Throne.
titles.story: Game of Thrones is a critically acclaimed fantasy drama television series based on the series of novels titled 'A Song of Ice and Fire' by George R.R. Martin. Set in the fictional continents of Westeros and Essos, the series follows the power struggles among noble families as they vie for control of the Iron Throne of Westeros. The show is known for its complex characters, intricate plotlines, and political intrigue, as well as its gritty and realistic portrayal of the fantasy genre. Game of Thrones has received widespread praise for its production values, storytelling, and ensemble cast.

titles.name: Stranger Things
titles.short-desc: A group of kids in a small town encounter supernatural creatures and government conspiracies when their friend goes missing.
titles.story: Stranger Things is a popular science fiction horror drama television series created by The Duffer Brothers. Set in the 1980s in the fictional town of Hawkins, Indiana, the series follows a group of kids who become friends and embark on a quest to find their missing friend, encountering supernatural creatures and uncovering government conspiracies along the way. Stranger Things pays homage to 80s pop culture and is known for its nostalgic atmosphere, compelling storytelling, and a talented ensemble cast.

titles.name: His Dark Materials
titles.short-desc: A young girl embarks on a perilous journey through parallel universes, where she discovers secrets about her own identity and the nature of Dust.
titles.story: His Dark Materials is a fantasy adventure drama television series based on the book series of the same name by Philip Pullman. The story follows Lyra Belacqua, a young girl who lives in a world where people's souls manifest as animal companions called daemons. When her friend goes missing, Lyra embarks on a dangerous journey through multiple parallel universes, encountering mysterious beings, magical creatures, and uncovering a sinister plot involving the enigmatic substance called Dust. The series explores themes of self-discovery, free will, and the complex interplay between religion, science, and power.

titles.name: House of the Dragon
titles.short-desc: House of the Dragon is a fantasy drama TV series set in the world of Westeros, focusing on the Targaryen family's history.
titles.story: House of the Dragon is a prequel to the popular TV series Game of Thrones, based on George R.R. Martin's book 'Fire & Blood.' It is set 300 years before the events of Game of Thrones and chronicles the rise of House Targaryen. The story delves into the history of the Targaryen family, including the civil war known as the Dance of the Dragons. It explores the Targaryens' journey to power, their dragons, and the internal conflicts within the family that eventually lead to their downfall.

titles.name: Iron Man
titles.short-desc: A billionaire industrialist and weapons manufacturer creates a unique exoskeleton suit that gives him superhuman strength and agility, but his world is changed forever when he is forced to use it to fight evil forces.
titles.story: Tony Stark (Robert Downey Jr.), a billionaire industrialist and weapons manufacturer, is kidnapped by a terrorist group in Afghanistan. While being held captive, he is forced to build a weapon of mass destruction. However, he instead creates a unique exoskeleton suit that gives him superhuman strength and agility. Stark escapes from the terrorists and returns to the United States, where he uses his new suit to fight evil forces.

titles.name: Iron Man 2
titles.short-desc: Tony Stark's world is changed forever when he is forced to confront his past and deal with the consequences of his actions.
titles.story: Tony Stark (Robert Downey Jr.) is now a public figure as Iron Man, and he is struggling to balance his superheroics with his personal life. He is also facing new threats, including a mysterious enemy who is trying to steal his technology.

titles.name: Iron Man 3
titles.short-desc: When Tony Stark's world is torn apart by a terrorist attack, he must rebuild himself and face his demons.
titles.story: Tony Stark (Robert Downey Jr.) is now a public figure as Iron Man, and he is struggling to balance his superheroics with his personal life. He is also facing new threats, including a mysterious enemy who is trying to steal his technology. After a terrorist attack leaves him physically and emotionally scarred, Stark must rebuild himself and face his demons.

titles.name: The Incredible Hulk
titles.short-desc: A scientist tries to cure himself of unwanted gamma radiation exposure, but instead transforms into a gigantic green monster.
titles.story: Dr. Bruce Banner (Edward Norton) is a brilliant scientist who is cursed with a condition that causes him to transform into a gigantic green monster when he becomes angry. Banner tries to find a cure for his condition, but he is pursued by the military, who want to use his power for their own ends.

titles.name: Thor
titles.short-desc: Arrogant warrior Thor is cast out of Asgard to live among humans as punishment for his reckless behavior.
titles.story: Thor (Chris Hemsworth) is a powerful Asgardian prince who is banished to Earth by his father, Odin (Anthony Hopkins), after he brings dishonor to the kingdom. Thor must learn humility and responsibility as he lives among humans and struggles to regain his lost hammer, Mjolnir.

titles.name: Captain America: The First Avenger
titles.short-desc: During World War II, Steve Rogers is transformed into Captain America to fight the Red Skull and his HYDRA forces.
titles.story: Steve Rogers (Chris Evans), a frail young man, volunteers for a top-secret experiment that turns him into Captain America, a super-soldier. Captain America must use his newfound strength and abilities to battle the Red Skull (Hugo Weaving), a Nazi villain who plans to use a powerful weapon to conquer the world.

titles.name: Thor: The Dark World
titles.short-desc: Thor and Loki must team up to save the Nine Realms from Malekith, the leader of the Dark Elves.
titles.story: Thor (Chris Hemsworth) and Loki (Tom Hiddleston) are forced to put aside their differences when Malekith (Christopher Eccleston), the leader of the Dark Elves, threatens to plunge the Nine Realms into darkness. Thor must travel to the realm of Svartalfheim to retrieve the Aether, a powerful weapon that Malekith seeks to use to destroy the universe. Along the way, Thor must also face his own inner demons as he struggles to control his anger.

titles.name: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
titles.short-desc: Captain America and Black Widow must team up to stop a mysterious force that is attacking S.H.I.E.L.D. from within.
titles.story: Steve Rogers (Chris Evans), aka Captain America, is now living in the modern world and working for S.H.I.E.L.D. When a mysterious force attacks S.H.I.E.L.D. from within, Captain America and Black Widow (Scarlett Johansson) must team up to stop them. Along the way, they uncover a conspiracy that threatens the entire world.

titles.name: Dark
titles.short-desc: A German science fiction thriller television series created by Baran bo Odar and Jantje Friese.
titles.story: Dark is a German science fiction thriller television series created by Baran bo Odar and Jantje Friese. The series is set in the fictional town of Winden, Germany, and follows the aftermath of a child's disappearance. The show explores themes of time travel, parallel universes, and family secrets. Dark has been praised for its complex storytelling, atmosphere, and performances.

titles.name: Breaking Bad
titles.short-desc: A high school chemistry teacher diagnosed with inoperable lung cancer turns to a life of crime to secure his family's financial future.
titles.story: Breaking Bad is an American crime drama television series created and produced by Vince Gilligan. The show follows Walter White (Bryan Cranston), a high school chemistry teacher who is diagnosed with inoperable lung cancer. Desperate to secure his family's financial future, White turns to a life of crime by producing and selling methamphetamine with his former student, Jesse Pinkman (Aaron Paul). The series explores themes of family, friendship, crime, and redemption.

titles.name: The Last of Us
titles.short-desc: A post-apocalyptic drama series about a smuggler tasked with escorting a teenage girl across the United States.
titles.story: The Last of Us is a post-apocalyptic drama series based on the 2013 video game of the same name. The series follows Joel Miller (Pedro Pascal), a smuggler tasked with escorting a teenage girl named Ellie (Bella Ramsey) across the United States in the aftermath of a pandemic that has turned most of humanity into cannibalistic creatures. Along the way, they must face the dangers of the infected, as well as the human survivors who are just as dangerous.

titles.name: Sherlock
titles.short-desc: The quirky spin on Conan Doyle's iconic sleuth pitches him as a 'high-functioning sociopath' in modern-day London. Assisting him in his investigations: Afghanistan War vet John Watson, who's introduced to Holmes by a mutual acquaintance.
titles.story: Sherlock is a British crime drama television series based on Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's Sherlock Holmes detective stories. The series stars Benedict Cumberbatch as Sherlock Holmes and Martin Freeman as Dr. John Watson. Set in modern-day London, the series follows Holmes and Watson as they investigate a variety of crimes, including murder, theft, and espionage.

titles.name: Money Heist
titles.short-desc: An unusual group of robbers attempt to carry out the most perfect robbery in Spanish history - stealing 2.4 billion euros from the Royal Mint of Spain.
titles.story: Money Heist is a Spanish heist crime drama television series created by Álex Pina. The series follows a group of thieves who plan to pull off the biggest heist in Spanish history – stealing €2.4 billion from the Royal Mint of Spain.

titles.name: The Vampire Diaries
titles.short-desc: The lives, loves, dangers and disasters in the town, Mystic Falls, Virginia. Creatures of unspeakable horror lurk beneath this town as a teenage girl is suddenly torn between two vampire brothers.
titles.story: The Vampire Diaries is an American supernatural drama television series based on the book series of the same name by L. J. Smith. The series follows Elena Gilbert (Nina Dobrev), a teenage girl who falls in love with two vampire brothers, Stefan Salvatore (Paul Wesley) and Damon Salvatore (Ian Somerhalder).

titles.name: Behind Her Eyes
titles.short-desc: It follows Louise, a single mom with a son and a part-time job in a psychiatrist's office. She begins an affair with her boss and strikes up an unlikely friendship with his wife.
titles.story: Behind Her Eyes is a British psychological thriller television miniseries based on the 2017 novel of the same name by Sarah Pinborough. The series follows Louise, a single mother who begins an affair with her new boss, David. However, she soon discovers that David is married to Adele, a woman who seems to be hiding a dark secret.

titles.name: Lucifer
titles.short-desc: Lucifer Morningstar has decided he's had enough of being the dutiful servant in Hell and decides to spend some time on Earth to better understand humanity. He settles in Los Angeles - the City of Angels.
titles.story: Lucifer is an American fantasy drama television series developed by Tom Kapinos. The series is based on the DC Comics character of the same name, who appears in the comic books published by DC Comics. The series follows Lucifer Morningstar, the Devil, who abandons Hell for Los Angeles where he runs his own nightclub named Lux. Lucifer becomes a consultant to the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) helping the department solve crimes due to his vast knowledge of human nature and his powers.

titles.name: Dexter
titles.short-desc: He's smart. He's lovable. He's Dexter Morgan, America's favorite serial killer, who spends his days solving crimes and nights committing them.
titles.story: Dexter Morgan is a blood spatter analyst for the Miami Metro Police Department who moonlights as a serial killer, hunting down and killing other murderers. Dexter is driven by his 'Dark Passenger', a voice in his head that compels him to kill. He is able to control his urges by following a strict code of ethics.

titles.name: The Punisher
titles.short-desc: After his revenge on those who murdered his family, aimless Marine veteran Frank Castle finds a new meaning in life as a vigilante known as 'The Punisher'.
titles.story: The Punisher is an American action crime drama television series developed for Netflix by Steve Lightfoot. Based on the Marvel Comics character of the same name, the series stars Jon Bernthal as Frank Castle, a former United States Marine who operates as a vigilante in New York City, known for his extensive use of firearms and willingness to kill criminals.

titles.name: Peaky Blinders
titles.short-desc: A gangster family epic set in 1900s England, centering on a gang who sew razor blades in the peaks of their caps, and their fierce boss Tommy Shelby.
titles.story: Peaky Blinders is a British period crime drama television series created by Steven Knight. Set in Birmingham, England, the series follows the exploits of the Shelby family, a gang of criminals who are involved in illegal betting, protection rackets, and smuggling.

titles.name: FBI: Most Wanted
titles.short-desc: It follows the division of the FBI tasked with tracking and capturing the notorious criminals on the FBI's Most Wanted list.
titles.story: FBI: Most Wanted is an American crime drama television series created by Dick Wolf and Hank Steinberg for CBS. The series is a spin-off of Wolf's 2013 series, FBI. The series follows the Fugitive Task Force, a unit of the FBI that is responsible for tracking down and apprehending the country's most wanted criminals.

titles.name: Marcella
titles.short-desc: Marcella Backland left the Metropolitan Police for the sake of her family, only to have her husband leave her. She returns to her job on the murder squad, investigating a case that seems disturbingly familiar to her.
titles.story: Marcella Backland is a detective in the Metropolitan Police who suffers from blackouts and short-term memory loss. When her husband is murdered, Marcella is determined to find the killer, but her memory loss makes it difficult to piece together the clues. As she gets closer to the truth, Marcella begins to question her own sanity.

titles.name: The Witcher
titles.short-desc: Geralt of Rivia, a solitary monster hunter, struggles to find his place in a world where people often prove more wicked than beasts.
titles.story: The Witcher is a fantasy drama television series based on the book series of the same name by Polish author Andrzej Sapkowski. The series follows the story of Geralt of Rivia, a mutated monster-hunter for hire, and his companions as they navigate the turbulent world of the Continent.

titles.name: Shadow and Bone
titles.short-desc: Alina Starkov, a young orphan living in the kingdom of Ravka, discovers she has a rare power that could be the key to saving her country from an ancient enemy.
titles.story: Shadow and Bone is an American fantasy television series based on Leigh Bardugo's Shadow and Bone trilogy and Six of Crows duology. The series follows Alina Starkov, a young orphan living in the kingdom of Ravka, who discovers she has a rare power that could be the key to saving her country from an ancient enemy.

titles.name: Carnival Row
titles.short-desc: In a neo-Victorian city where humans and fairies coexist, a police inspector investigates a string of murders targeting the fairy population.
titles.story: Carnival Row is a fantasy drama television series created by Travis Beacham and Ridley Scott. The series is set in a neo-Victorian city where humans and fairies coexist, but not always peacefully. The series follows a police inspector, Rycroft Philostrate, as he investigates a string of murders targeting the fairy population.

titles.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power
titles.short-desc: Set in the Second Age of Middle-earth, The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power follows the forging of the Rings of Power, the rise of the Dark Lord Sauron, and the epic struggle between good and evil that would ultimately decide the fate of Middle-earth.
titles.story: The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power is an American fantasy television series based on the works of J.R.R. Tolkien. The series is set in the Second Age of Middle-earth, thousands of years before the events of The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings. The series follows the forging of the Rings of Power, the rise of the Dark Lord Sauron, and the epic struggle between good and evil that would ultimately decide the fate of Middle-earth.

titles.name: Titans
titles.short-desc: A young Dick Grayson, who is still reeling from the death of his parents, teams up with other young heroes to form the superhero team known as Titans.
titles.story: Titans is an American superhero television series based on the DC Comics characters of the same name. The series follows a young Dick Grayson, who is still reeling from the death of his parents, as he teams up with other young heroes to form the superhero team known as Titans. The series also features appearances from other DC Comics characters, such as Starfire, Raven, Beast Boy, and Hawk and Dove.
